definition: to sequester/to seal up (for safe keeping)/to freeze (an account)/to mothball
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive

sentences.english: It is now in flyable storage in Fort Worth.
sentences.chinese: 它现在在封存在沃斯堡。

sentences.english: Manchester City have decided to retire their number 23 shirt in tribute to Marc-Vivien Foe.
sentences.chinese: 曼城已经决定将福的23号球衣封存以祭奠他。

sentences.english: When the timer runs out the door will be locked forever, locking away the antidote inside it.
sentences.chinese: 到时门将永久被锁住，解药也会以后封存。

sentences.english: The technique of comprehensive cocooning can keep the cocooned from rusting for 2-5 years.
sentences.chinese: 综合封存技术可以保证被封存件2～5年不生锈。

sentences.english: The technique of comprehensive cocooning can keep the cocooned from rusting for 2-5 years.
sentences.chinese: 综合封存技术可以保证被封存件2～5年不生锈。

sentences.english: The key is to ensure that future coal plants are using CCS.
sentences.chinese: 关键是确保今后的燃煤发电厂使用碳捕获和封存技术。

sentences.english: All language files are embedded in this archive.
sentences.chinese: 所有的语言档案都内嵌在这个封存档中。

sentences.english: Not only words and epithets fossilise , whole situations can fossilise too.
sentences.chinese: 不仅词和形容词封存，整个情况可以封存了。

sentences.english: Not only words and epithets fossilise , whole situations can fossilise too.
sentences.chinese: 不仅词和形容词封存，整个情况可以封存了。

sentences.english: After that the records are sealed.
sentences.chinese: 在这些记录被封存起来之后。

sentences.english: Under the new regulations, a third of government cars have been mothballed.
sentences.chinese: 按照新规定，三分之一的公家车封存。

sentences.english: The ceremony was the 2008 Olympic Games wine "drunkard" and so on in this archive.
sentences.chinese: 2008年奥运会庆功酒“酒鬼”等就封存于此。

sentences.english: Such wrongly wrought proteins need to be binned before they cause substantial damage.
sentences.chinese: 这些折叠出错的蛋白质在引发灾难前就需要被封存。

sentences.english: Used protective suits pile up outside the nuclear plant. They will eventually be placed inside containers.
sentences.chinese: 穿过的防护服堆积在核电站外，最后封存处理。

sentences.english: However, the decision was made to add this document into the soviet archive.
sentences.chinese: 但是，最终决定将其封存在苏维埃档案馆。

definition: to destroy (by melting or burning)/to obliterate
to deposit/to store/to leave in sb's care
covered in dust/dusty/lying unused for a long time
to keep/to preserve/extant/to remain (from the past)
to conserve/to preserve/to keep/to save (a file etc) (computing)
to open sth that has been sealed
